title: Mo Farah's claims there were racial elements in questioning over Alberto Salazar scandal is nothing short of insulting
text:
That Mo Farah came out swinging when speaking to the media ahead of Sunday’s Chicago Marathon was perhaps no surprise given his repeated refusals to accept any error over his association with the now disgraced coach Alberto Salazar.

So when it came to questions over Salazar’s four-year ban from the sport or the permanent closure of his Nike Oregon Project training group, it was a given Farah would fight back. That is his default setting. Nothing to see here. Or here. Or here.

But there was one aspect of his defence that was particularly galling. To suggest there has been a racial element to Farah’s coverage in recent years is nothing short of insulting.
